section.title: DocBook to HTML - Block Elements
section.para: This module handles most simple block-level elements, turning them into the appropriate HTML tags. It does not handle tables, lists, and various other complex block-level elements.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Renders a block-level element to an HTML div tag

listitem.para: The block-level element to render
An extra string to insert in the class attribute
Whether this is the first child block in the parent
Whether this block should be indented
Whether to maintain whitespace as written
Whether this is a formal block element
When formal is true, an element to use for the title
When formal is true, an element to use for the caption
The locale of the text in node
The text direction, either ltr or rtl
Whether to default to ltr if neither lang nor dir is specified

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This template creates an HTML div element for the given DocBook element. This template uses the parameters to construct the class attribute, which is then used by the CSS for styling.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This template creates an HTML pre element for the given DocBook element. This template uses the parameters to construct the class attribute, which is then used by the CSS for styling.
If node has the linenumbering attribute set to "numbered", then this template will create line numbers for each line, using the db.linenumbering template.
